title: Beauty & Wellness Briefing: Is this the end of foam sunscreen? —plus, industry news
summary: This week, I checked in with formulation and packaging experts to break down the FDA letters sent to sunscreen brands like Vacation and Supergoop warning that their whipped and foam sunscreens are not in compliance with federal law. The brands have 15 days to respond, which is likely to include a recall of products from Sephora, Ulta Beauty, Target, CVS, Revolve and Nordstrom shelves. Additionally, Sephora bets on another artist-founded color cosmetics line, P&G Beauty gets a new CEO, and OneSkin takes on $20 million in funding as biotech-powered beauty heats up.

title: Blake Lively announced as Glossy Pop NYC speaker
summary: We’re excited to have Lively speak about the evolution of Blake Brown at Glossy Pop NYC on September 5.

title: From tennis to baseball to the NFL, jewelry brands are embracing sports for viral growth

The contrast between the intensity and performance of sports and the luxuriousness of fine jewelry makes for an odd pairing. But as the line between sports and the rest of culture increasingly blurs, jewelry brands are finding the massive audience of sports and NIL athletes too tempting to ignore.

title: Where did Target and Ulta Beauty’s shop-in-shop partnership go wrong?

But the next digital frontier — artificial intelligence — has sparked far more ambivalent feelings.

title: What’s old is new again: Why centuries-old fragrance brands are undergoing a revival
summary: Brands like D’Orsay and Santa Maria Novella form a roster of centuries-old perfume houses that have staged comebacks and expansions amid the post-Covid fragrance boom. If done successfully, those revitalized names can tap into an existing brand universe and hundreds of years of history to speak to niche perfume consumers’ desire for heritage and authenticity.

title: Beauty & Wellness Briefing: Olaplex taps Glamsquad as competition in the pro space heats up, plus industry news
summary: This week, I checked in with execs and analysts to better understand the changes within the hair-care space that are driving today’s marketing, seeding and sales.
